Add Core Data to the octomod

Source: R/core.R
core.Rd

Add the shared dataset for this research question to the central octomod structure. Whenever this is used, it will replace the prior or old data.

core() adds a new dataset to the octomod object. It checks to see if data is already present.

change_core() changes the old dataset from the octomod object to an updated dataset. It does not re-do the hypothesis testing.

core(octomod, core)

change_core(octomod, new_core, ...)

remove_core(octomod, ...)

Arguments

octomod

Object of class octomod
core

Data frame or tibble object
new_core

A modified or new data frame to be used
...

For extensibility

Value

octomod object with core data attached

Examples

library(magrittr)

octomod() %>%
  core(mtcars) %>%
  change_core(iris)

#> 
#> This `octomod` has the following components. 
#> 
#> Core Variables 
#> -------------- 
#> [1] "Sepal.Length" "Sepal.Width"  "Petal.Length" "Petal.Width"  "Species"     
#> 
#> Arms 
#> ---- 
#> NULL
#> 
#> Equipment 
#> ---- 
#> NULL
